data.text:
Those who fail to learn from the past are bound to repeat it. This is the succinct explanation of the importance of history for the advancement of human society. Before history became a normalized profession, it was always part of our lives as human beings. As each generation learns from the mistakes of its past and shapes its behavior in response to its previous experiences, the knowledge is passed on to its children and siblings.

While the information necessary for survival was limited thousands of years ago, this is no longer the case today. The complex nature of human society and the hundreds of thousands of events in its history have necessitated the creation of a dedicated group of people to scrutinize the trash and provide us with the essential knowledge needed to move our society forward. Lola Van Wagenen is among those who have dedicated themselves to this higher task. Who is Lola Van Wagenen? Learn more about the American historian below.

Bio of Lola Van Wagenen

Lola Van Wagenen is known for her advocacy of history education, consumer activism, and as co-founder of Consumer Action Now and Clip Visualizing History, a documentary production company.

The historian was born in Provo, Utah to MormonParents. Ironically, there is no family history information available from the historian. We do know, however, that she was born in December 1938 and to a Dutch father, if her name sounds like anything.

Although she was raised as a follower of the Mormon religion, Lola, since becoming an adult, has explored and consulted other forms of religious and philosophical knowledge.

With nothing known of his high school and childhood, our knowledge of his educational history begins from the undergraduate days. She received a bachelor’s degree from Vermont College, where she graduated in 1982, and then a master’s degree from New York University in 1984. She also earned a master’s degree in public history. After 10 years of research and academic work, she obtained a doctorate. in American History at New York University.

Her excellent doctoral dissertation was later turned into a book which was published in 2003. The book was titled “Sister Wives and Suffragists: Polygamy and the Politics of Woman Suffrage 1870-1896”.

Her academic career spans several decades, during which she received the Distinguished Alumni/Alumnae Achievement Award from New York University’s Graduate School of Arts and Sciences.

Career

She has served on various academic boards, including the Robertson Scholars selection committee at Duke University and the University of North Carolina. She served on the Appropriate Technology Task Force with the United States Office of Technology Assessment and was a member of the National Commission for the International Year of the Child.

In her professional career outside of academia, Lola Van Wagenen first rose to national fame as the wife of veteran actor Robert Redford. Lola’s professional career, however, was not defined by the short-lived marriage. She went on to serve as executive producer of several documentaries and films.

She has a business alongside Jeanne Houck, another historian called Clio Visualizing History Inc. The documentary production company has produced several documentaries and short films both for its clients and for its own internal projects.

Lola Van Wagenen is also a well-known consumer activist who started Consumer Action Now, a non-profit organization. Since its inception, the organization has recorded several achievements, including the passage of the Toxic Substances Control Act and the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act.

Other accomplishments include an honorary doctorate from the Pratt Institute.

Net value

Lola Van Wagenen has two businesses that have been modestly successful. His documentary production company, Clio Visualizing History, Inc, has produced several short films and documentaries. So, in addition to the income from her college career, Lola was able to build up a net worth of $2 million.

husband, children, grandchildren

Before Lola Van Wagenen began her life as an outdated historian and documentarian, she was married to Robert Redford in 1957. The marriage lasted 18 years and the two had four children namely: Amy Redford, James Redford, Shauna Redford and Scott Anthony Redford.

After their divorce in 1985, however, Lola went many years without getting married until 2002, when she married her current wife, George Burrill, an entrepreneur who runs an international development company.

Lola Van Wagenen has five grandchildren from the relationships of her two daughters, Shauna Redford, Amy Redford and her son, James Redford.
